entries.title: The Papers: Better times ahead, says PM, and tributes to Pope
entries.description: The first front pages of 2023 cover a range of stories, including Rishi Sunak promising "better times ahead".

entries.title: TV presenter Matthew Bassett shows life goes on with spinal injury
entries.description: A trip to the beach changed Matthew Bassett's life - now he's determined to say yes to everything.

entries.title: Mikel Arteta plays down Arsenal's title hopes despite seven-point lead at New Year
entries.description: Mikel Arteta and Bukayo Saka insist Arsenal are not getting carried away, despite leading the league by seven points at the end of 2022.

entries.title: Pope Francis and world leaders pay tribute to Benedict XVI
entries.description: The head of the Catholic Church pays his respects to his predecessor Benedict, who resigned from his post in 2013.

entries.title: Cody Fisher: Two charged with Birmingham nightclub stabbing murder
entries.description: Non-league footballer Cody Fisher was fatally attacked on the dance floor of a club in Birmingham.

entries.title: Brighton & Hove Albion 2-4 Arsenal: Gunners extend lead to seven points
entries.description: Arsenal move seven points clear at the top of the Premier League despite a second-half wobble at Brighton.

entries.title: UN seeks top court opinion on Israeli occupation
entries.description: The vote has been hailed a victory by Palestinians and described as "despicable" by Israel.

entries.title: Ukraine war: Zelensky tells Russians - Putin is destroying you
entries.description: Ukraine's president says his country will never forgive Russians for the terror they have inflicted.

entries.title: Premiership: Saracens 35-3 Exeter Chiefs - Leaders earn bonus-point win
entries.description: Saracens earn a comprehensive victory over rivals Exeter to take their lead at top of the Premiership back to 10 points.

entries.title: Wallasey pub shooting: Police release third person arrested
entries.description: The 31-year-old had been arrested on suspicion of conspiracy to murder but has now been released.

entries.title: Newcastle United 0-0 Leeds United: Magpies held but end 2022 third in table
entries.description: Newcastle will finish 2022 third in the Premier League despite being held to a goalless draw by Leeds at St James' Park.

entries.title: Manchester City 1-1 Everton: Demarai Gray cancels out Erling Haaland opener
entries.description: Manchester City end the year with a point against Everton in a fractious Premier League affair at Etihad Stadium.

entries.title: Wolves 0-1 Manchester United: Erik ten Hag says Marcus Rashford had 'right answer' after being dropped
entries.description: Manchester United manager Erik ten Hag says Marcus Rashford had the "right answer" after coming on and scoring the winner against Wolves having been dropped to the bench for "internal disciplinary" reasons.

entries.title: New Year's Eve: World celebrates arrival of 2023
entries.description: As the festivities get under way, here is a snapshot of some of the events happening across the globe.

entries.title: Wolves 0-1 Man Utd: Marcus Rashford comes off bench to score winner
entries.description: Marcus Rashford scores the winner for Manchester United in the Premier League at Wolves after being dropped to the bench for disciplinary reasons.

entries.title: Scarborough: Rare walrus sighting draws huge crowds to harbour
entries.description: Local wildlife experts say it may be the first time a walrus has been seen in Yorkshire.

entries.title: Assange to ask for prison leave for Westwood funeral, says wife
entries.description: The Wikileaks founder fighting extradition to the US will seek leave from Belmarsh, his wife says.

entries.title: WSL transfer window: Who could be on the move this January?
entries.description: A number of Women's Super League clubs are set to be active in the January transfer window - so what can we expect?

entries.title: Severe flooding brings Hogmanay disruption
entries.description: The West Coast Mainline is closed between Carlisle and Scotland but a landslip in Fife has now been cleared.

entries.title: Football Focus: Gary Lineker pays tribute to 'joyous human being' Pele
entries.description: BBC Sport's Gary Lineker pays tribute to Pele, recalling his own meetings with the Brazil legend who died this week.

entries.title: Ukraine war: Explosions hit capital Kyiv
entries.description: Kyiv Mayor Vitaly Klitschko says there is damage in several districts of the city and one person has died.

entries.title: Marcus Rashford: Manchester United drop forward to bench for disciplinary reasons
entries.description: Manchester United forward Marcus Rashford loses his place in the starting XI for Saturday's Premier League game at Wolves for disciplinary reasons.

entries.title: United Cup: Cameron Norrie beats Rafael Nadal as Britain go 2-0 up over Spain
entries.description: Cameron Norrie beats Rafael Nadal for the first time before Katie Swan sees off Nuria Parrizas-Diaz in the United Cup.

entries.title: NBA: LeBron James scores 47 points in Los Angeles Lakers win over Atlanta Hawks
entries.description: LeBron James shines on his 38th birthday as the Los Angeles Lakers beat the Atlanta Hawks 130-121.

entries.title: Marathon man Gary McKee starts 365th run of year in £1m charity bid
entries.description: Gary McKee is bidding to raise £1m for charity having run 26.2 miles every day this year.

entries.title: Former Pope Benedict XVI dies at 95
entries.description: Benedict, who has died at his Vatican residence, became the first pope to resign for 600 years in 2013.

entries.title: Winter set to be worst ever for A&E waits, health leaders warn
entries.description: Demand for hospitals driven by winter illness means the NHS is being "pressurised like never before".

entries.title: Benedict: The Pope who resigned from the papacy
entries.description: Obituary of Benedict XVI, a conservative figure who became the first pope to stand down in 600 years.

entries.title: 25 big sporting events to look forward to in 2023
entries.description: The 2023 sporting calendar features World Cups in women's football and men's rugby union as well as men's and women's Ashes cricket series and the Ryder Cup.

entries.title: Will rain ruin fireworks? Your New Year's Eve forecast
entries.description: Planning to go out to see in the New Year? Matt Taylor has the all-important forecast for Saturday evening.

entries.title: West Cowick woman charged with murder after fatal stabbing
entries.description: Teresa Hanson, 53, is due to appear in court in Hull charged with killing Paul Hanson, 54.

entries.title: Bellator v Rizin: AJ McKee on his father, being a 'teddy bear' and the Pitbull trilogy
entries.description: AJ McKee speaks to BBC Sport before his headlining bout against Roberto de Souza at the Bellator v Rizin cross-promotional event on Saturday.

entries.title: Barbara Walters: Trailblazing US news anchor dies aged 93
entries.description: The first woman to front a US evening news programme, she interviewed every US president from Richard Nixon to Donald Trump.

entries.title: Ginni Thomas: US Supreme Court justice's wife says she regret her post-election texts
entries.description: Virginia Thomas' remarks are among a mountain of transcripts released by the US Capitol riot inquiry.

entries.title: Press Association photographers pick their top shots of 2022
entries.description: Press Association photographers reflect on their best images from the past year.

entries.title: North Korea ends year with ballistic missiles launch
entries.description: Pyongyang has fired more missiles this year than ever before as it focuses on weapons development.

entries.title: Happisburgh: The Norfolk village crumbling into the sea
entries.description: A nurse says she is heartbroken that nothing can be done to save her house from coastal erosion.

entries.title: 2022 viral videos: Six social media moments that charmed Indians
entries.description: From a confusing news debate to a nude photoshoot, there was plenty to keep Indian social media buzzing.

entries.title: Citizen scientists join fight to clean up rivers
entries.description: The past year has seen public outrage over sewage with volunteers taking action into their own hands.

entries.title: From Rosalía to Beyoncé: 25 of the best songs released in 2022
entries.description: From Beyoncé and Harry Styles to Eliza Rose and Cat Burns, here are some of the years top tracks.

entries.title: Pele in Africa: The man, the myth, the legend
entries.description: The first black football icon had a huge impact in Africa and his trips to the continent were full of drama.

entries.title: 14 headlines that made 2022... in 74 seconds
entries.description: Watch a selection of some of the most momentous stories covered by BBC News this year.

entries.title: Premier League team of 2022: Opta gives its starting XI of the year
entries.description: With Premier League football back on the cards and 2023 almost upon us, it's time to find out who makes Opta's team of the year.

entries.title: New Year's Eve parties hit by rail strikes and cost of living
entries.description: New year bookings at bars and restaurants are down due to rail strikes and price rises, industry experts say.

entries.title: Gucci & Paris Fashion Week: How my dyslexia made me an artist
entries.description: Street artist Navinder has been making waves in fashion, but his journey has been far from easy.

entries.title: The UK's problems will not all go away in 2023, says Rishi Sunak
entries.description: The PM says 2022 has been tough but promises to focus on people's priorities, in New Year's message.
